DataElement.preferredName: Date Diagnostic slides Formaldehyde Fixed Specimen Paraffin Embedded Tissue Tumor Block Biospecimen Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Diagnostic slides Formaldehyde Fixed Specimen Paraffin Embedded Tissue Tumor Block Collection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to materials taken from the human body, such as tissue, blood, plasma, and urine that can be used for cancer diagnosis and analysis.. Is a thin flat piece of glass used to look at specimens through a microscope. A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic. Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin. A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells. These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining. The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Diagnostic slides Formaldehyde Fixed Specimen Paraffin Embedded Tissue Tumor Mass Block Collection
Property.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists:A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.:Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.:Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.:A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.:Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Concepts.definition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.
Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.
Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.
A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.
Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.
